Elior Rahmani, PhD
Postdoctoral researcher
Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences, UC Berkeley
erahmani [at] berkeley [dot] edu

[CV] [Google Scholar] [LinkedIn]

I am a postdoctoral researcher in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences at UC Berkeley, advised by Nir Yosef and Michael Jordan.

I work in the fields of computational biology and machine learning. The primary focus of my research is the development of novel unsupervised and semi-supervised machine learning methods for capturing hidden signals arising from heterogeneous and high-dimensional genomic datasets.

I completed my PhD in Computer Science at UCLA, advised by Eran Halperin, and my MSc in Computer Science and BSc in Computer Science and Biology at Tel Aviv University.
